data.name: Marching armies
data.description:
Picture yourself a fantasy themed map of a kingdom. The kingdom is divided into a number of provinces. Armies travel in real time across the map between the provinces. What we need is a function that can calculate the position of an army based on how far the army has travelled (called marching in this context).

For example if the army has marched half of the needed time, the calculated position must be halfway between the positions of the two provinces.

An army can also be standing still in a province, in which case its position is the same as the province's. If it is marching, it will always travel in a straight line between two provinces. Note that provinces can be anywhere relative to each other (so it is possible to march in the negative direction of the axis).

Four different objects are available, below are listed their interfaces:

```javascript
Position: // Example of anonymous position object
// Coordinates must be integers (round off when nessesary)
{
  x : 100,
  y: 200;
}
```

```javascript
Player:
{
  isMarching() // Returns boolean to whether it has an active order
  getProvince() // Returns the latest province it was standing in
  getOrder() // Returns an active order if there is one
  setPosition(position) // Updates the player's current position with the given position object. Returns true if successful, false if not
}
```

```javascript
Province:
{
  getPosition() // Returns position object
}
```

```javascript
Order:
{
  getOrigin() // Returns province start
  getDestination() // Returns province end
  getDepartTime() // Returns Date object of departure time
  getArrivalTime() // Returns Date object of arrival time
  
}
```

Lastly, updateTime delivered as input is a Date object and will always be after an order's depart time.
